content.rendered:
AqualisBraemar, through its signatory status with United Nations Global Compact, recognises that human rights are at the centre of the Social Development Goals (SDG). We believe that without human dignity we will fail to drive sustainable development and this is why are ensuring that energy and the oceans are at the centre of our business; the sustainability of both is vital for the future of our company and the world in which we operate and live.

“AqualisBraemar ASA supports the 17 SDGs of the United Nations Global Compact that are linked to human rights, labour, environment and anti-corruption. The theme of this year’s Human Rights Day is ensuring we recover from the pandemic by putting human rights central to the world’s recovery. To build back better, not just in terms of the energy transition, but in terms of reaffirming the importance of human rights in re-building the world we want, is what we should be striving for.” stated David Wells, CEO.

AqualisBraemar is a global marine, energy and marine consultant servicing the renewables, maritime, oil and gas and adjusting sectors.

For further information, please contact:

Endre Johansen, Corporate Communications AS
Telephone: +47 41 61 06 05
Email: endre.johansen@corpcom.no

About AqualisBraemar ASA

AqualisBraemar ASA (OSE: Aqua) offers independent consultancy services to the offshore energy (oil & gas and renewables), shipping and insurance industries. The group employs specialist engineers, naval architects, master mariners, loss adjusters and technical consultants in 33 countries worldwide. AqualisBraemar ASA operates under three brands:
  • AqualisBraemar: a leading adjusting, marine and offshore consultancy to the energy, shipping and insurance industries
  • AqualisBraemar Yacht Services: a specialised marine consultant to the superyacht market
  • OWC: an independent consultancy to the offshore renewables sector

jetpack-related-posts.title: AqualisBraemar supports UN Global Compact
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: By signalling this intent, AqualisBraemar commits to making the UN Global Compact, and its principles, part of the strategy, culture and day-to-day operations of the company, and to engage in collaborative projects which advance the broader development goals of the United Nations, particularly its sustainable development goals.

jetpack-related-posts.title: AqualisBraemar supports the call for renewed global cooperation
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: As a signatory of the United Nations Global Compact, AqualisBraemar supports the call for renewed global cooperation.

jetpack-related-posts.title: AqualisBraemar supports World Oceans Day
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: At AqualisBraemar, energy and the oceans are at the centre of our business. The sustainability of both is vital for the future of our company and the world in which we operate.

jetpack-related-posts.title: AqualisBraemar sets up office in North East of England
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: AqualisBraemar has set up a new office in the Port of Tyne to support its rapidly developing rig inspection services and to be closer to numerous clients in the North East of England.

jetpack-related-posts.title: AqualisBraemar to acquire LOC Group
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: AqualisBraemar ASA has entered into an agreement to acquire 100 percent of the shares in LOC Group, thereby creating a leading global independent offshore energy and marine consultancy.

jetpack-related-posts.title: AqualisBraemar shortlisted for Energy Transition award
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: AqualisBraemar has been shortlisted for EIC's Energy Transition Award in their annual EIC Awards. The award recognises companies that contribute or demonstrate the next wave of technologies, beyond wind and solar, that will deliver the 2050 net-zero carbon goals of the UK.
